column4: I have a ATi Rage Mobility 128 AGP 2X video card in my dell c600. Can someone show me directions to get the 3d graphics working?
am glad i am not alone....same here 3d no work on radeon 9000 trxing 2 days
yeah, the other day I was trying to get a radeon working on my laptop, but havn't got it yet. Now i'm trying to help a friend
please tell me if it works for you...al that fglrx and other
i tried the hardware section of the getting started section of ubuntu help (System>Help), but I think that is for a newer version than I have.
mine is older than yours
which radeon you daid you have?
aha i see ati Rage mobility my opinion after 2 days of suffering it should do fine on clean install with open source ati drivers
Radeon Mobility 7500
that fglrx shit did not work for me i even think there is something missing somewhere
the fglrx driver failed with my ATi Rage Mobility 128 AGP on my dell c600. Is there any way I can get 3D Graphics?
which metod did u use?
http://help.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/desktopguide/C/hardware.html
wait let me see that method...i'll be back
have you used System>Help>Ubuntu Starter Guide>Hardware>How do I install the 3D ATI video card driver?
no that was the first method i used and it did not work for me neither...maybe you should read this
wait a sec...
Which was the first one you tried, the link or the help?
well i tried about everything but do not know in which order and not always on clean install...

you would not believe but it matters on what drivers you install with wich method...ok i think the most promissing text is on this site:http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Dapper_Installation_Guide
it says "The included fglrx driver supports Radeon 8500+ and the X-series cards up to X1900."
i have not tried out the method 1 on that page on fresh Dapper instalation and method 2 not at all...and after 2 days wondering how i've heard the method 1 works fine on radeon 8500
donfilipo:so it won't work with my gateway which has 7500. but maybe with the dell (rage mobility)
yeah mobility clean install dapper if you can and use method 1 first maybe it will do
